# Example Requirements Document

## Course Enrollment Platform

We need a web platform for course enrollment where students can browse available courses, enroll, and make payments.

### Goals
- Students can browse and search for courses
- Students can enroll in courses online
- Students can pay for courses securely
- Admins can manage the course catalog
- Generate reports for finance team

### Constraints
- Budget: less than $150 per month for hosting
- Prefer AWS infrastructure
- Must release MVP in 6 weeks
- Must comply with PCI-DSS for payment processing
- Support up to 1,000 concurrent users initially

### Features

1. **User Authentication**
   - Student and admin login
   - Password reset functionality
   - Email verification

2. **Course Catalog**
   - List all available courses
   - Course details page (description, instructor, schedule, price)
   - Filter by category, price, schedule

3. **Search Functionality**
   - Search courses by name, instructor, or keywords
   - Auto-complete suggestions

4. **Shopping Cart**
   - Add/remove courses
   - View total price
   - Apply discount codes

5. **Checkout & Payment**
   - Integrate with Stripe for payment processing
   - Support credit card payments
   - Email confirmation after successful payment

6. **Admin Dashboard**
   - CRUD operations for courses
   - Manage instructors
   - View enrollment statistics

7. **Reports**
   - Revenue reports by course
   - Enrollment trends
   - Export to CSV

### Stakeholders
- Students (primary users)
- Course administrators
- Finance team
- System administrators

### Technical Hints
- React for frontend
- Node.js/Express for backend
- PostgreSQL database
- AWS hosting (EC2 + RDS)
- Stripe for payments

requirements.summary: A web platform for course enrollment allowing students to browse, enroll, and make payments for courses, while providing admins the ability to manage the course catalog and generate finance reports.
goals: Students can browse and search for courses
Students can enroll in courses online
Students can pay for courses securely
Admins can manage the course catalog
constraints: Budget: less than $150 per month for hosting
Must comply with PCI-DSS for payment processing
Support up to 1,000 concurrent users initially

tickets.title: Set up EC2 instances for application hosting
tickets.description: Configure and launch EC2 instances to host the course enrollment platform application, ensuring scalability and security.
acceptanceCriteria: EC2 instances are running with the application deployed

tickets.title: Set up RDS for PostgreSQL
tickets.description: Configure RDS instance to run PostgreSQL, ensuring it is secure and scalable for the course enrollment platform.
acceptanceCriteria: RDS instance is running PostgreSQL

tickets.title: Configure security groups and roles
tickets.description: Set up security groups and roles for AWS services to ensure least privilege access and secure the environment.
acceptanceCriteria: Security groups and roles are configured for least privilege access

tickets.title: Monitor and optimize infrastructure costs
tickets.description: Implement monitoring and optimization strategies to ensure the infrastructure cost does not exceed $150 per month.
acceptanceCriteria: Infrastructure cost does not exceed $150 per month

tickets.title: Implement user registration
tickets.description: Develop the functionality for users to register with email and password, supporting roles for student and admin users.
acceptanceCriteria: Users can register with email and password
Admin and student roles are supported and can be distinguished

tickets.title: Implement user login
tickets.description: Develop the functionality for users to log in with email and password, ensuring security and support for different roles.
acceptanceCriteria: Users can log in with email and password

tickets.title: Design course catalog schema
tickets.description: Design the database schema for the course catalog, including tables for courses, categories, and relationships.
acceptanceCriteria: Database schema supports courses, categories, and relationships
Schema is normalized to prevent data redundancy

tickets.title: Implement schema for efficient browsing and searching
tickets.description: Implement the database schema to allow for efficient browsing and searching of the course catalog.
acceptanceCriteria: Schema allows for efficient browsing and searching

tickets.title: Implement course catalog browsing
tickets.description: Develop the frontend and backend functionality for students to browse the course catalog. This includes displaying courses, filtering by category, and viewing course details.
acceptanceCriteria: Users can view a list of courses
Users can filter courses by category
Users can view detailed information about each course

tickets.title: Implement search functionality
tickets.description: Enable students to search for courses by keywords. This requires implementing search functionality on the backend and a search interface on the frontend.
acceptanceCriteria: Users can search for courses using keywords
Search results are relevant and ranked by relevance
Search performance is optimized for up to 1,000 concurrent users

tickets.title: Develop shopping cart functionality
tickets.description: Create the functionality for students to add courses to a shopping cart, view the cart, update quantities, and remove courses. This includes both frontend and backend development.
acceptanceCriteria: Users can add courses to a shopping cart
Users can view their shopping cart
Users can update course quantities and remove courses from the cart

tickets.title: Integrate Stripe for payment processing
tickets.description: Integrate Stripe for secure online payments, allowing students to pay for courses within the platform. Ensure the integration complies with PCI-DSS requirements.
acceptanceCriteria: Users can pay for courses using Stripe
Payment process is secure and complies with PCI-DSS
Users receive confirmation of successful payment

tickets.title: Build admin dashboard for course management
tickets.description: Develop an admin dashboard that allows course administrators to add, update, and remove courses from the catalog. This includes both frontend and backend components.
acceptanceCriteria: Admins can add new courses to the catalog
Admins can update existing courses
Admins can remove courses from the catalog

tickets.title: Implement report generation for finance team
tickets.description: Create functionality for generating financial reports related to course enrollments and payments. This should be accessible to the finance team through a secure interface.
acceptanceCriteria: Finance team can generate reports on enrollments and payments
Reports are accurate and up-to-date
Access to reports is secure and restricted to the finance team

pros: Breaking down the project into specific, actionable tickets ensures clarity and focus for the development team.
Prioritizing tickets based on the MVP requirements ensures that the team works on the most critical features first.
Assigning effort points helps in sprint planning and resource allocation, ensuring that the project stays on track.
Dependencies between tickets are clearly identified, which aids in planning the development workflow and prevents bottlenecks.
cons: The initial setup of tickets requires a significant upfront investment of time and effort, which could delay the start of actual development.
Changes in project requirements or scope may necessitate revisiting and adjusting many tickets, leading to potential project delays.
Estimating effort points can be challenging and inaccurate, especially for complex features or those with unclear requirements.
alternatives: Kanban approach: Instead of detailed sprint planning, a more fluid Kanban system could be used to manage tasks, which might be more adaptable to changes.
Feature-driven development: Organizing work around complete features rather than splitting them into backend and frontend tasks could potentially streamline development.
